metadata.description: Deploys a SAP HANA HA cluster. If necessary, will call the separate script to build the prerequisite networks
metadata.author: Jason Tenpenny

metadata.description: Enter the SAP Instance ID you plan to use.
Enter the Database Instance Number you plan to use. Most commonly this is left at '00'.
Define the username for the jumpbox VM.
Enter a password to use for logging into the jumpbox VM.
Define the username for the database VMs.
Enter a password to use for logging into the database VMs.
Choose a name prefix for the Hana database VMs. The deployment will append 1 or 2 to the end, as appropriate.
Enter a name for the public IP resource on the jumpbox.
Used to enable or disable the automated setup of the disks and volumes on the database VMs.

Determines if the template attempts to automatically install SAP. If you already have the software stored in an Azure Storage Account as a blob file, then you could choose to have it downloaded and installed on the VM automatically. If you haven't put the software in an Azure Storage Account (or you don't want to automatically install SAP), change this value to false.
Name of storage account where SAP Media exists. This will only be used if you elect to install SAP automatically.
Enter the folder path to the SAP Installation media. It should be in the format 'blobName/folder/path'. Do not include the filename. This will only be used if you elect to install SAP automatically.
Enter the filename of the SAP install package. This will only be used if you elect to install SAP automatically.
Choose whether to use an existing VNet or deploy a new VNet with either a NAT Gateway or Azure Firewall. Accepted values: 'newWithNatgw', 'newWithAzfw', 'existing'.

If you are using an existing VNet, provide the full resource ID. The script expects to place the jumpbox in a subnet called 'jumpbox-subnet' and place the database VMs in a subnet called 'db-subnet'. If these subnets don't exist, either create them or choose one of the options to create a new VNet.
If you are using an existing VNet, provide the name of the NSG attached to the database subnet. It will attach that same NSG to the NICs on the database VMs.
If you have elected to create a new VNet, this value will be used to help ensure that all your resource names are unique.
Enter an IP address to use for allowing access to jumpbox-subnet. Will only be used if you are deploying new network infrastructure.
Value must ber set to an int so multiple CSEs can be deployed to the same VM.

protectedSettings.commandToExecute: [concat('sh sap_install.sh ', parameters('SAPInstanceID'), ' ', parameters('SAPInstanceNumber'), ' ', parameters('hanaPassword'), ' ', variables('sapInstallMediaUri'), ' ', parameters('SAPInstallMediaFilePath'))]
